document_data.name: Mount Grimmerfang
document_data.caption: ''A map of the Vast showing Mount Grimmerfang.''
document_data.mainbody: The '''Hollow Mountain''', later called '''Mount Grimmerfang''', was a mountain in [[the Vast]] in [[north Faerûn]]. It was the capital of both the [[orc]] kingdom of [[Vastar]] and the [[dwarf]] kingdom of [[Roldilar]].
document_data.History:
The mountain was originally known as the "Hollow Mountain".

At some point, the monstrous orc [[Ologh]] rose to the position of [[Overking]] of Vastar, and created a throne for himself, holding court from the Hollow Mountain. When Ologh the Overking was killed by the [[black dragon]] [[Iyrauroth]] in the [[572 DR|Year of Writhing Darkness, 572 DR]], the throne was left vacant and Vastar descended into civil war.

Eventually, [[Grimmerfang]] defeated his last rival and seized the throne in the [[580 DR|Year of the Loose Coins, 580 DR]]. Orc-King Grimmerfang renamed the Hollow Mountain after himself, to Mount Grimmerfang.

However, dwarves invaded and Vastar fell in the [[610 DR|Year of the Spellfire, 610 DR]]. The dwarves took Mount Grimmerfang from the orcs and slew Grimmerfang himself at the mountain. He was left entombed there.

The same year, the dwarves founded the kingdom of Roldilar, under [[Deep King]] [[Tuir Stonebeard]]. Tuir placed his throne deep beneath Mount Grimmerfang and held court from there. It was here in the [[645 DR|Year of the Costly Gift, 645 DR]], that [[Maskyr One-Eye]] bought the vale of [[Maskyr's Eye]] from King Tuir.

Resurgent orcs engulfed Roldilar in the [[649 DR|Year of the Bloody Crown, 649 DR]] 

Knowledge of the location of Mount Grimmerfang eventually became lost. Those few dwarven elders still alive by [[1370 DR]] who could still identify Mount Grimmerfang refused to tell [[human]]s or [[elves]] about it.

Iyrauroth returned to Mount Grimmerfang sometime between [[1369 DR]] and [[1373 DR]] and laired there.
document_data.Location: By 1370 DR, the [[sage]] [[Elminster]] of [[Shadowdale]] estimated Mount Grimmerfang to be the first peak north-east of [[Mount Wolf]], placing it in the [[Giantspike Mountains|Giantspike]] or [[Earthspur Mountains]]. However, he'd not investigated this himself to confirm.The map on page 145 of ''[[The City of Ravens Bluff]]'', seen in the sidebar, depicts Mount Grimmerfang as actually just south-east of Mount Wolf.
